title: Roberto Carlos lifts the lid on life with Beckham, Figo and Zidane in Real Madrid's Galactico era
text:
Real Madrid and Brazil icon Roberto Carlos has lifted the lid on life as a Galactico, painting a picture of jetsetting and player-power at the heart of the most notorious era at any club in modern football.

The full-back was in a team littered with star talent but which in the end produced very little of substance to show for it, with just three La Liga titles and one solitary Champions League title picked up between 2000 and 2007 despite the massive spending power.

Despite a lack of success on the pitch, though, Carlos reveals that the players - including the likes of Luis Figo, Zinedine Zidane and David Beckham - enjoyed a lifestyle that few footballers had ever experienced before.

Roberto Carlos (centre) has lifted the lid on what life was like among Real Madrid's Galacticos

The Brazilian claims that all the top stars used to jetset around the world after matchdays

Carlos (right) spent 11 years in Madrid, with Zinedine Zidane (left) and David Beckham (right)

'Today when I’m looking back I think; how is it possible that we got away with so much craziness?' he told AS.

'After every game it was private jets left, right and centre. We’d meet up at the private terminal at Barajas and Beckham would be off god knows where, Figo and Zidane would be off somewhere or other, Ronaldo and me… and we always had to train the day after tomorrow.

'I used to pray for Saturday fixtures so I could go to the Formula 1 on Sunday. It was private jets all over the place. It was crazy.'

The defender had a fondness for Formula One and used to attend races on his free Sundays

Carlos sits with David Beckham and his wife Victoria during the ATP Madrid Masters in 2003

At the Bernabeu, Carlos found himself playing alongside one of his close friends Ronaldo, whom he first met while on international duty in 1993.

Having built up such a close relationship over the years, the former Inter defender admits he spent more time with the striker than he did with his other half, admitting: 'I met Ronaldo in 1993 and from that moment we always shared the room. I’ve slept more times with Ronaldo than my wife.'

Another story told by Carlos demonstrates the power held by the players at that time during the presidential reign of Florentino Perez.

Carlos revealed he started rooming with close friend Ronaldo from 1993 while team-mates

Carlos was part of a star-studded Real Madrid side (top row from left) Iker Casillas, Ivan Helguera, Ronaldo, Esteban Cambiasso, Luis Figo, Zinedine Zidane, (bottom row from left) Michel Salgado, Beckham, Roberto Carlos, Raul, Raul Bravo;

Vanderlei Luxemburgo was brought in to coach Real Madrid at the start of the 2004 season.

However, after rubbing players up the wrong way, he was quickly dismissed, as Carlos explains.

'In the second game of the league season we had the custom of leaving our bags in the hotel and going for a beer or a wine before dinner.

'There were always two bottles of wine on the table. Ronaldo and me told him [Luxemburgo]: "Professor, people here have their habits, you’ll see what they are, but don’t try to change them. Don’t take the wine off the table or stop the beers before dinner or you’ll find yourself with a problem."

'What did he do? First he took away the wine, then he banned the beers. He lasted three months. Football is a small world, the directors heard about it and it was “adios”.'

Vanderlei Luxemburgo attempted to change players' habits when he joined Real as head coach
